summary: The 'Ensuring Fee-Free Benefit Transactions Act of 2025' amends the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to permanently ban fees on SNAP (Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program) benefit transactions for retailers. It prohibits states, their agents, and contractors from charging fees for EBT transactions, including switching and routing, related to SNAP benefits. The amendment overrides the provisions of the Consolidation Appropriations Act, 2023, and takes effect October 1, 2025.
